results.title: Wool: fashion's choice for '62
results.creator_credit: Frank Land and Australian Wool Corporation
results.brief_description: Models strut the latest wool fashions, using locations around Melbourne as their backdrop. Some of these localities include the banks of the Yarra, Captain Cook’s Cottage, St Kilda Pier, King’s Domain, the Botanical and Exhibition Gardens, and the Myer Music Bowl. Commentated by Roger Climpson, Fashion adviser: Sybil Jackson and photographed by George Heath.

results.title: A Future without frontiers
results.creator_credit: Geo Tapparelli, Intergovernmental Committee for European Migration and Carlo di Carlo
results.brief_description: Produced to commemorate the twenty year of ICEM’s existence, this film aims to highlight one of the fundamental human rights - the freedom of movement - and to demonstrates at the same time that through well-planned migration an effective contribution can be made to people looking for better opportunities as well as to countries overseas to strengthen their economic position for further development. Looks at the various programmes carried out by ICEM in the last twenty years and projects some expected future problems of people and their movement in the world.

results.title: Happy Transgender Awareness Week
results.material_description: Digital screen recording of @alexpepsii's Tiktok post
results.brief_description:
Transgender Awareness Week aims to raise the visibility of transgender people and address issues faced by the community. Social media plays an important role, with users sharing their own stories and amplifying the voices of transgender people. This video celebrates Transgender Awareness Week through a compilation of transgender characters in recent film and television, from Raúl in Wendell & Wild to Natalie in Big Mouth.
Transgender Awareness Week is a one-week celebration held annually from 13 - 19 November. It leads up to Transgender Day of Remembrance on 20 November which memorialises the victims of transphobic violence.
results.description:
This video features in a responsive display in the museum that presents the moments, stories and memes capturing the zeitgeist by going viral on the internet.

Transgender Awareness Week raises the visibility of transgender people and address issues faced by the community. Social media plays a vital role, with users sharing their stories and amplifying the voices of transgender people. This video celebrates Transgender Awareness Week through a compilation of transgender characters in recent film and television, from Raúl in Wendell & Wild to Natalie in Big Mouth. Transgender Awareness Week is held from 13 to 19 November, and leads to Transgender Day of Remembrance, which memorialises victims of transphobic violence.

Social media plays a vital role, with users sharing their stories and amplifying the voices of transgender people. This video celebrates Transgender Awareness Week through a compilation of transgender characters in recent film and television, from Raúl in Wendell & Wild to Natalie in Big Mouth. Transgender Awareness Week is held from 13 to 19 November, and leads to Transgender Day of Remembrance, which memorialises victims of transphobic violence.

results.title: The Long journey
results.creator_credit: United Nations. Film Board and Rank Screen Services
results.brief_description: War has left its mark on Korea. Three million refugees joined the ranks of the homeless and hungry and the countryside was maimed and scarred. This film tells of Kim Tai Yung, a farmer from North Korea and one of those refugees who made their way to the South and freedom in 1951. As a background to Kim’s gradual progress the task of United Nations rehabilitation and reconstruction is seen to take shape and move into action.

results.title: On the side of the angels
results.creator_credit: Peter Kaufmann, Open Channel Productions and Claire Jaeger
results.brief_description:
This film presents the story of the people involved in the
movement for peace in Australia from 1900 to the present. Using rare archival film, the program reflects on the international events that concerned and influenced many people to organise together for peace and world stability. Features Ralph Gibson, founding member against war and fascism in the 30s, Stephen Murray-Smith, peace historian, Sam Goldbloom, Council for International Cooperation and Disarmament, Jim Cairns, Deputy Prime Minister with the Whitlam government, Jean McLean, radical Victorian Labour MP and Jo Camilleri, Convenor of People for Nuclear Disarmament.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Peter Kaufmann, Open Channel Productions and Claire Jaeger

results.title: I Look up, I look down
results.brief_description: A body falls gracefully through the air, kilometres from the earth, seeming to hover between falling, then rising again in a fluid dance that suspends and evades gravity. This looping video installation playfully dispels any laws of science as the casually dressed skydiver that we see floating through the air never gets closer to the ground. Moving hypnotically around the camera the body disorients all sense of up and down until at one point it seems to float, buffeted by the air, toward a passing plane.

results.title: Melbourne rising
results.creator_credit: Campbell Manderson, Sam De Silva and SKA TV
results.brief_description: ‘Melbourne Rising’ is a video document about the S11 protests against the World Economic Forum at Crown Casino in Melbourne. The protests aimed to shut down the summit in opposition to the injustices of corporate driven globalisation. After its release in late September 2000, Melbourne Rising was screened and broadcast in Canada, the Czech Republic, Germany, Italy, the Neteherlands, New Zealand, Switzerland, the UK and the USA. It also featured in numerous film festivals across Australia as well as Korea and India.
